ci_support_linux_64_python3.10.____cpyth:
c_compiler:
- gcc
c_compiler_version:
- '14'
c_stdlib:
- sysroot
c_stdlib_version:
- '2.17'
channel_sources:
- conda-forge
channel_targets:
- conda-forge main
cxx_compiler:
- gxx
cxx_compiler_version:
- '14'
docker_image:
- quay.io/condaforge/linux-anvil-x86_64:alma9
fortran_compiler:
- gfortran
fortran_compiler_version:
- '14'
libblas:
- 3.9.* *netlib
liblapack:
- 3.9.* *netlib
openmpi:
- '5'
pin_run_as_build:
  python:
    min_pin: x.x
    max_pin: x.x
python:
- 3.10.* *_cpython
target_platform:
- linux-64
zip_keys:
- - c_compiler_version
  - cxx_compiler_version
  - fortran_compiler_version

about.description: DBCSR is a sparse matrix library designed to efficiently perform sparse matrix-matrix multiplication, among other operations. It is MPI and OpenMP parallel, and can exploit accelerators. DBCSR was developed as a part of CP2K, where it provides core functionality for linear scaling electronic structure theory. It is now released as a standalone library for integration in other projects..
about.summary: DBCSR is a sparse matrix library designed to efficiently perform sparse matrix-matrix multiplication.

name: dbcsr

about.description: DBCSR is a sparse matrix library designed to efficiently perform sparse matrix-matrix multiplication, among other operations. It is MPI and OpenMP parallel, and can exploit accelerators. DBCSR was developed as a part of CP2K, where it provides core functionality for linear scaling electronic structure theory. It is now released as a standalone library for integration in other projects..
about.summary: DBCSR is a sparse matrix library designed to efficiently perform sparse matrix-matrix multiplication.

raw_meta_yaml:
schema_version: 1

context:
  name: dbcsr
  version: "2.9.1"

package:
  name: ${{ name }}
  version: ${{ version }}

source:
  - url: https://github.com/cp2k/dbcsr/releases/download/v${{ version }}/dbcsr-${{ version }}.tar.gz
    sha256: fa5a4aeba0a07761511af2c26c779bd811b5ea0ef06a5d94535b6dd7b2e0ce59
    patches:
      - dbcsr-shared.patch

build:
  number: 0
  skip: win

requirements:
  build:
    - ${{ stdlib('c') }}
    - ${{ compiler('c') }}
    - ${{ compiler('cxx') }}
    - ${{ compiler('fortran') }}
    - cmake
    - make
    - if: linux
      then: libgomp
    - if: osx
      then: llvm-openmp
  host:
    - if: linux
      then: libgomp
    - if: osx
      then: llvm-openmp
    - python
    - libblas
    - liblapack
    - openmpi
  run:
    - python
  run_exports:
    - ${{ pin_subpackage(name, upper_bound='x') }}

tests:
  - script:
      - if: unix
        then:
          - test -e ${PREFIX}/include/dbcsr.h
          - test -e ${PREFIX}/include/dbcsr_api.mod
          - test -e ${PREFIX}/include/dbcsr_tensor.h
          - test -e ${PREFIX}/include/dbcsr_tensor_api.mod
          - test -e ${PREFIX}/lib/cmake/dbcsr/DBCSRConfig.cmake
          - test -e ${PREFIX}/lib/cmake/dbcsr/DBCSRConfigVersion.cmake
          - test -e ${PREFIX}/lib/cmake/dbcsr/DBCSRTargets-release.cmake
          - test -e ${PREFIX}/lib/cmake/dbcsr/DBCSRTargets.cmake
          - test -e ${PREFIX}/lib/libdbcsr${SHLIB_EXT}
          - test -e ${PREFIX}/lib/libdbcsr_c${SHLIB_EXT}


about:
  homepage: https://cp2k.github.io/dbcsr
  summary: DBCSR is a sparse matrix library designed to efficiently perform sparse matrix-matrix multiplication.
  description: DBCSR is a sparse matrix library designed to efficiently perform sparse matrix-matrix multiplication, among other operations. It is MPI and OpenMP parallel, and can exploit accelerators. DBCSR was developed as a part of CP2K, where it provides core functionality for linear scaling electronic structure theory.
    It is now released as a standalone library for integration in other projects..
  license: GPL-2.0-only
  license_file: LICENSE
  repository: https://github.com/cp2k/dbcsr
  documentation: https://cp2k.github.io/dbcsr/develop/page/2-user-guide/index.html

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - martin-g
